short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Predicts run outcomes for each ball in an over.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
New ands Improved version 6  .Remember this is for Fun and Entertainment only and is an Experiment .Can be used for Tests ,ODI s and T20I s .

To use this extension firstly you have to apply it in a very contextual manner suppose the predicted outcome states  in the over is 1, 0,0,0,0,1 and the predicted runs in the states 2 runs will be scored in the over and in the actual context its different then apply the next prediction to the match  so that it replicates the matches first two balls and you might see a similar result for balls 4 5 6 or vice versa.

I believe that understanding these factors can help predict the outcome of an over, but no one has fully cracked this "over code" yet. I've put together several factors that I think are key to solving this puzzle. If you're interested, I invite you to experiment with these factors yourself and see if you can uncover the secret to predicting over outcomes.
